topic.title: Failure during "Create new site"
topic.body:
Using clean installs on both Windows and OS X, my attempts to use the web interface to create a new site fails at the publish stage. "Content publish failed."

The various tutorials and videos seem to show either a Linux install with access to the source, or an earlier version (2016) showing command line use. The command line example does not correspond to the current ZeroNet install. Have I committed a common mistake or do I have a configuration problem?

Thank you for your time.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CTW7mNXKtUtmi1jM8z6TdG5KLE6c3DGSE/

A correspond Zero Blog:

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1MsYyip6dvvFx2FYnAuK2uXiXs4ufsCbEa/

1_1vAdpJiyYEHcDZoJn93QcjzaFVKHHPg1F.body:
The page in question:

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CTW7mNXKtUtmi1jM8z6TdG5KLE6c3DGSE/

The function calculates the hash of strings using several common algorithms, then creates a Google search link by which you can determine if the hash exists in a publicly available rainbow table. I created it for experience with nodejs-crypto and to help several friends avoid choosing bad passwords. (Yes, 12345).
Thank you for the assistance. I did not advertise my site due to my belief of an error.

1_145w1yniK8RaBKx468iMXcgunojqrJFNG5.body: I find it easier to close the launched browser, then launch the Tor with the http://127.0.0.1:43110 URL.

4_19xyLs9tyTZF9JaEcWBk5JtgWdYtQPQwt3.body:
> [7c4](#comment_11_12HT4jASzPG2B9vGbzvrbeyjw3jBUgqUfq): Yes, I use Bitmessage over Tor. Distributed and anonymous, what more could one want?

Jello...

3_15dMbdM7c2RT9RhNTJRqzc4vYSvrSJvxyG.body:
I also encourage use of Tiddlywiki. I set a tiddler as my Zite's index page: 

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CTW7mNXKtUtmi1jM8z6TdG5KLE6c3DGSE/

The page localized code is a great convenience - usually. Some aspects of the Tiddlywiki code seem to conflict with ZN's function.

Is mise le meas.

The markup seems to conflict with ZN in some cases. One being ZN URLs. In my tests, such links failed using [[ ... ]] notation, working when using notation. Another error I encountered originated in part of the ZN engine, complaining about a loop on "bools." Server error Err: TypeError: argument of type 'bool' is not iterable in UiServer.py line 94 > UiRequest.py line 128 > UiRequestPlugin.py line 22 > TranslateSitePlugin.py line 25 > FilePackPlugin.py line 66 > UiRequest.py line 473 > BigfilePlugin.py line 111 > BigfilePlugin.py line 381 When in doubt, use HTML5.
